author: The Editorial Board
title: After Zuma in South Africa
text:
Lawmakers in South Africa celebrated in Cape Town this week when Cyril Ramaphosa was sworn in as the countryâ€™s fifth post-apartheid president. The ascension of Mr. Ramaphosa marks the end of the nine-year Jacob Zuma era, which few South Africans will mourn. 

The charismatic Mr. Zuma, a former African National Congress (ANC) militant who spent a decade imprisoned with Nelson Mandela, moved his party notably to the left. He expanded government, blew out the public fisc and treated the state like his personal fiefdom. Investors...
